resources.string:
Great your settings preferences have been set!

The following questions will focus on your movement capabilities.

Then you will be asked to select some dance moves and a song genre that will be used to generate a dance video for you to follow.

Can you confirm you are happy to proceed?
The first few questions will get the brightness, volume, and text size adjusted to your preferences.\n\nWould you like the screen brighter?

Welcome!

This app will ask some physical capabilities questions and generate dance videos for you to follow based on the moves you select.

On screens where you can see yes or no buttons you can either verbally respond 'yes' or 'no' once the question has been asked and you see the blue listener eyes pop-up in the bottom left corner, or you can tap the buttons instead.

Questions with multiple answers must be selected by hand as no voice recognition is enabled for these.
Would you like the screen darker?
Would you like the volume louder?
Would you like the volume quieter?
Is the text the right size for you?
Would you like the text bigger?
Would you like the text smaller?
Your dance video will play below
How physically challenging did you find that dance?
How well were you able to follow the moves during the dance?

Would you like to change your level?
See the descriptions for each level below:

Baseline level - 8 reps per move at 100BPM

Medium level - 12 reps per move at 110BPM

Hard level - 16 reps per move at 120BPM
Are you able to lift your hands above shoulder height without any pain or discomfort?
The session has now ended.\n\nEnjoy the rest of your day!
Are you able to sit-up in bed from a lying position without any pain or discomfort?
Are you able to twist your torso to both sides and look over your shoulder without any pain or discomfort?
How do you typically stand up from a chair?
Unable to stand up from a chair
With full assistance from another person
With some assistance (e.g., cane, walker, person)
Independently, but need to use arms
How difficult is it for you to climb one flight of stairs?
How difficult is it for you to climb several flights of stairs?
How difficult is it for you to walk around your home?
How difficult is it for you to walk continuously for 10 minutes without stopping?
How difficult is it for you to carry a bag of groceries across a room?
How difficult is it for you to bend down and pick up a small object (e.g. a book) from the floor?
Very often (5 or more times a week)
Approximately how much total time do you spend exercising or being physically active in a typical week?
How many times a week do you participate in vigorous exercise? (e.g. running, lifting heavy objects, strenuous sports)
How many times a week do you participate in moderate exercise? (e.g. gardening, moving a table, pushing a vacuum cleaner, bowling, golf)
Before the dance begins lets make sure you are happy with the distance of the robot.\n\nThe researcher will move the robot for you, measure this distance, pass you the maracas, and then press play.
Now lets re-adjust the distance of the robot so that you can answer the feedback questions.\n\nThe researcher will take the maracas, move the robot, measure the distance, and then click continue.
